trailingComments.value: If appropriate, serve data as JSON(P)

leadingComments.value: If appropriate, serve data as JSON(P)

trailingComments.value: If second argument is a string, we take that to mean it refers to a view.
If it was omitted, use an empty object (`{}`)

leadingComments.value: If second argument is a string, we take that to mean it refers to a view.
If it was omitted, use an empty object (`{}`)

trailingComments.value: If a view was provided in options, serve it.
Otherwise try to guess an appropriate view, or if that doesn't
If no second argument provided, try to serve the implied view,
but fall back to sending JSON(P) if no view can be inferred.

leadingComments.value: If no second argument provided, try to serve the implied view,
but fall back to sending JSON(P) if no view can be inferred.
If a view was provided in options, serve it.
Otherwise try to guess an appropriate view, or if that doesn't

*
 * 200 (OK) Response
 *
 * Usage:
 * return res.ok();
 * return res.ok(data);
 * return res.ok(data, 'auth/login');
 *
 * @param  {Object} data
 * @param  {String|Object} options
 *          - pass string to render specified view

comments.value:
*
 * 200 (OK) Response
 *
 * Usage:
 * return res.ok();
 * return res.ok(data);
 * return res.ok(data, 'auth/login');
 *
 * @param  {Object} data
 * @param  {String|Object} options
 *          - pass string to render specified view
If appropriate, serve data as JSON(P)
If second argument is a string, we take that to mean it refers to a view.
If it was omitted, use an empty object (`{}`)
If a view was provided in options, serve it.
Otherwise try to guess an appropriate view, or if that doesn't
If no second argument provided, try to serve the implied view,
but fall back to sending JSON(P) if no view can be inferred.
